page.title: 07RUSHALL CHURCH
page.content: Rushall Church Of Christ was built in 1887 and is a very small daughter church which was not built to last. It is constructed from a metal frame covered with corrugated metal. It has a porch for notices. A bell fell from the roof twenty years ago, missing the vicar by inches. The original pews are old and worn. The organ, which was bought second hand is not used now because it squeaks. The Victorian font is made of stone. Services are Sundays and Wednesdays. Baptisms and funerals are held here, but the church does not have a licence for weddings. In winter the church is very cold and in summer it is very hot.
